title: Jennifer Aniston has 'changed her mind' about doing Friends reboot
text:

Back in December, Jennifer Aniston appeared on The Late, Late Show with James Corden to promote her Netflix film Dumplin.

While there, she opened up about the possibility of doing a Friends reboot or reunion.

And fans were thrilled to hear her say that all of the former female cast members were up for it.

The 50-year-old said: "Listen, the girls always say we would love to do it again."

But it seems the star might have had a change of heart in the last few months as she had a very different answer when asked about it this week.

(Image: NBC via Getty Images)

During an interview on Howard Stern's Sirius XM Radio on Monday, the actress best known for her role as Rachel Green on Friends, confessed that while she missed the show, a reboot wasn't a good idea.

She told the radio host: "We all miss it every day. I would be nothing without it […] If there’s a reboot of the show, it won’t be as good as what it was, so why do it? It would ruin it."

Her words echoed those of Friends co-creator Marta Kauffman who has always insisted that a reboot would never happen.

She famously said: "The show is about a time in your life when your friends are your family. It's not that time anymore. All we'd be doing is putting those six actors back together, but the heart of the show would be gone."

(Image: WireImage)

Aniston was also asked about her dating life while on the radio show - but she firmly shifted the conversation back to her work.

In reply to a question about whether she was seeing anyone since her split from former husband Justin Theroux in 2017, she stated: "I’m very busy. For now. I’m promoting [ The Morning Show ]. I’m prepping for next season."

However, the celeb did go on to reveal that she hates being set up on dates.

Stern suggested he set her up with someone, to which she responded: "Not right now. But listen, I just don’t like being set up. I don’t like it. Hate it."

Aniston is next set to appear in The Morning Show on Apple TV alongside Reese Witherspoon and Steve Carrell. The show premieres on November 1.
description: Jennifer Aniston once said she'd love to do a Friends reboot but it looks like she might have changed her mind
